title: Corsor
author: Corsor
created_time: April 03, 2023, 05:32:02 AMLast edit: July 04, 2023, 06:43:27 PM by Corsor
content: I am an experienced moderator and a marketing agent with over 8 years of experience. I am an enthusiastic , self-motivated , reliable , responsible and hardworking person. I am a mature team worker and adaptable to all challenging situations. I am able to work well both in team environment as well as  using own initiative.Skills:Community managementAffiliate marketingModerationCopywritingMultitaskingProblem-solvingTeamworkManaging ticketsActive  everydayWork Experience:NXT TECHONOLOGIES ( current )Role: ModeratorHaloRole: ModeratorDYPRole: ModeratorYou can dm me on telegram @genius1438

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: Corsor on April 03, 2023, 05:32:02 AMARE YOU LOOKING  FOR AN EXPERIENCE MODERATOR? YOU CAN PM ME THROUGH TELEGRAM @https://t.me/genius1438 AND WE CAN TALK ABOUT THE DETAILSAs you are a newbie no-one might be interested to send you a message by seeing only these types of posts. As you have created a topic you should post as much information as possible. Also, you should search for projects and apply to those projects. Here is an open project which you might be interested too https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5447685

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Corsor on June 24, 2023, 10:53:21 AMBump Available!!Shasan has given you pointers on what to add to your announcement thread from there you should take a cue but you choose to ignore we just want to help you to get more clients, I also doubt that you're going to get clients without posting your experience, projects you've worked with and years of experience, if you're a newbie in this forum you have to acquire something that will give you an edge over members who have experience in moderating.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on June 24, 2023, 02:53:06 PM I also doubt that you're going to get clients without posting your experience, projects you've worked with and years of experience, if you're a newbie in this forum you have to acquire something that will give you an edge over members who have experience in moderating.As a newbie, claiming to have experience as a moderator Is not just enough, anyone can claim to have an experience in moderation. If you really have an experience, you will need to prove it, not just saying by mouth that you are an experienced moderator. I do not doubt your experience, just saying that anyone who needs your service will need to be sure about your experience.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: When you have the word "experienced" in the work you're offering especially if the field is about managing and marketing, it will show the way you interact and the way you present yourself, and you never use all capital letters in your offer, it connotes you badly need a job and that doesn't look good.You lack professionalism and experience, if you're a service provider you should have excellent communication skills because this is the basic of freelancing.
